intro: Ononis saxicola var. cuartanensis, commonly known as the Cuartana rockcress, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions of southern Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and distinctive seed pods. This variety thrives in rocky and gravelly soils, often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its leaves are typically basal, linear, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. The plant is adapted to harsh environments, demonstrating resilience to cold and arid conditions.
